message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

This paper focuses on classifying Twitter accounts based on their type in the context of marijuana-related communications. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Social and Information Retrieval sub-categories of Computer Science. Specifically, it involves analyzing user behavior and communication patterns on Twitter, which falls under the Social Computing (cs.SOC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses natural language processing techniques to contextualize conversations related to marijuana, which falls under the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the need for better understanding of state-specific marijuana policymaking, which could fall under the Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) sub-category. Finally, the use of multiview embedding techniques suggests that the paper could also belong to the Statistical Learning (cs.SI) sub-category.
